title: U.S. public schools - average expenditure per pupil 1980 to 2016
yAxis: Expenditures per pupil in U.S. dollars
summary: The chart at hand is a line chart where the x axis denotes Year and a y axis denotes Expenditures per pupil in U.S. dollars. In total the number of data points it has is 33.
Overall Expenditures per pupil in U.S. dollars has increased over the Year.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 1980 and 1985.
Maximum Expenditures per pupil in U.S. dollars, about 12617.0 was reported at Year 2016
The lowest Expenditures per pupil in U.S. dollars, of value 2272.0 was reported at Year 1980
